titleStmt.title: Pointwise approximation of modified conjugate functions by matrix operators of conjugate Fourier series of 2π /r-periodic functions

affiliation.orgName: Faculty of Mathematics, Computer Science and Econometrics

analytic.title: Pointwise approximation of modified conjugate functions by matrix operators of conjugate Fourier series of 2π /r-periodic functions

application.desc: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

textClass.keywords: Rate of approximation; Summability of Fourier series

p.s: We extend the results of Xh.

div.head: Introduction

p.s: Let L p 2π /r (1 ≤ p < ∞) be the class of all 2π/r-periodic real-valued functions, integrable in the Lebesgue sense with the pth power over Q r = [-π/r, π/r] with the norm Taking into account the above relations, we will consider, for f ∈ L 1 2π /r , the trigonometric Fourier series as such a series of f ∈ L 1 2π in the following form:

div.formula: f L p 2π /r = f (•) L p 2π /r := Q r f (t)
Sf (x) := a 0 (f ) 2 + ∞ ν=1 a ν (f ) cos νx + b ν (f ) sin νx

p.s: with the partial sums S k f .
We also know that if f ∈ L 1 2π , then

div.formula: f (x) := - 1 π π 0 ψ x (t) 1 2 cot t 2 dt = lim →0 + f (x, ) = lim →0 + f r (x, ),

p.s: where, for r ∈ N, We will use the notations

div.formula: A n,r = ∞ k=0 |a n,k -a n,k+r |, A • n,r = n k=0 |a n,k -a n,k+r | for r ∈ N and T n,A f (x) := ∞ k=0 a n,k S k f (x) (n = 0, 1, 2, . . .)

p.s: for the A-transformation of Sf .

In this paper, we will study the estimate of | T n,A f (x)f r (x, )| by the function of modulus of continuity type, i.e. a nondecreasing continuous function ω having the following properties: ω(0) = 0, ω(δ 1 + δ 2 ) ≤ ω(δ 1 ) + ω(δ 2 ) for any 0 ≤ δ 1 ≤ δ 2 ≤ δ 1 + δ 2 ≤ 2π .
We will also consider functions from the subclass L p 2π /r ( ω) β of L p 2π /r for r ∈ N:

div.formula: L p 2π /r ( ω) β = f ∈ L p 2π /r : ω β (f , δ) L p 2π /r = O ω(δ) when δ ∈ [0, 2π] and β ≥ 0 ,

p.s: where

div.formula: ω β f (δ) L p 2π /r = sup 0≤|t|≤δ sin rt 2 β ψ • (t) L p 2π /r . It is easy to see that ω 0 f (•) L p 2π /r = ωf (•) L p 2π /r

p.s: is the classical modulus of continuity.
Moreover, it is clear that for β ≥ α ≥ 0

div.formula: ω β f (δ) L p 2π /r ≤ ω α f (δ) L p 2π /r

p.s: and consequently

div.formula: L p 2π /r ( ω) α ⊆ L p 2π /r ( ω) β .

p.s: The deviation T n,A f (x)f r (x, ) was estimated with r = 1 in [2] and generalized in [1] as follows:

div.formula: Theorem A ([1, Theorem 8, p. 95]) If f ∈ L p 2π ( ω) β with 1 < p < ∞ and 0 ≤ β < 1 -1

p.s: p , where ω satisfies the conditions:

div.formula: π π n+1 t -γ |ψ x (t)| ω(t) p sin βp t 2 dt 1/p = O x (n + 1) γ (1)

p.s: with 0 < γ < β + 1 p and

div.formula: π n+1 0 t|ψ x (t)| ω(t) p sin βp t 2 dt 1/p = O x (n + 1) -1 , (2
) then T n,A • f (x) -f x, π n + 1 = O x (n + 1) β+ 1 p +1 A • n,1 ω π n + 1 .

p.s: The next essential generalizations and improvements in [3, Theorem 1] were given.
In these results f r (x, ) and A n,r (with r ∈ N) instead of f 1 (x, ) = f (x, ) and A • n,1 , respectively, were taken.
We can formulate them as follows.

div.formula: Theorem B ([3, Theorem 1]) If f ∈ L p 2π , 1 < p < ∞, 0 ≤ β < 1 -1

p.s: p and a function ω of modulus of continuity type satisfies the conditions:

div.formula: π r(n+1) 0 t|ψ x (t)|| sin rt 2 | β ω(t) p dt 1/p = O x (n + 1) -1 (3) for r ∈ N, 2mπ r + π r(n+1) 2mπ r |ψ x (t)|| sin rt 2 | β ω(t -2mπ r ) p dt 1/p = O x (1)(4)

p.s: for a natural r ≥ 3, where m ∈ {1, . . .
[ r 2 ]} when r is an odd or m ∈ {1, . . .
[ r 2 ] -1} when r is an even natural number, and

div.formula: 2mπ r + π r 2mπ r + π r(n+1) |ψ x (t)|| sin rt 2 | β ω(t)(t -2mπ r ) γ p dt 1/p = O x (n + 1) γ , (5

p.s: for r ∈ N with 0 < γ < β + 1 p , where m ∈ {0, . . .
[ r 2 ]} when r is an odd or m ∈ {0, . . .
[ r 2 ] -1} when r is an even natural number.
Moreover, let ω satisfy, for a natural r ≥ 2, the conditions:

div.formula: 2(m+1)π r 2(m+1)π r -π r(n+1) |ψ x (t)|| sin rt 2 | β ω( 2(m+1)π r -t) p dt 1/p = O x (1),(6) 2
(m+1)π r -π r(n+1) 2(m+1)π r -π r |ψ x (t)|| sin rt 2 | β ω(t)( 2(m+1)π r -t) γ p dt 1/p = O x (n + 1) γ , (7
with 0 < γ < β + 1 p , where m ∈ {0, . . . [ r 2 ] -1}. If a matrix A is such that ∞ k=0 (k + 1) 2 a n,k = O (n + 1) 2 (8) and n l=0 r+l-1 k=l a n,k -1 = O(1) (9)

p.s: with r ∈ N are true, then

div.formula: T n,A f (x) -f r x, π r(n + 1) = O x (n + 1) β+ 1 p +1 A n,r ω π n + 1 . Theorem C ([3, Theorem 2]) Let f ∈ L p 2π , 1 < p < ∞, 0 ≤ β < 1 -1

p.s: p and a function ω of modulus of continuity type satisfy, for r ∈ N, the conditions: (4) and (5)

div.formula: with 0 < γ < β + 1 p , where m ∈ {0, . . . [ r 2 ]} when r is an odd or m ∈ {0, . . . [ r 2 ]

p.s: -1} when r is an even natural number.
Moreover, let ω satisfy, for a natural r ≥ 2, the conditions (6) and (7)

div.formula: with 0 < γ < β + 1 p , where m ∈ {0, . . . [ r 2 ] -1}. If a matrix A is such that ∞ k=0 (k + 1)a n,k = O(n + 1), (10

p.s: and (9) with r ∈ N are true, then

div.formula: T n,A f (x) -f r x, π r(n + 1) = O x (n + 1) β+ 1 p +1 A n,r ω π n + 1 .

p.s: In our theorems we generalize the above results considering 2π/r-periodic functions and using simpler assumptions.
In the paper b k=a = 0 when a > b.

div.head: Statement of the results

p.s: To begin with, we will present the estimates of the quantities

div.formula: T n,A f (x) -f r x, π r(n + 1)

p.s: and

div.formula: T n,A f (•) -f r •, π r(n + 1) L p 2π /r .

p.s: Finally, we will formulate some remarks and corollaries.

div.formula: Theorem 1 Suppose that f ∈ L p 2π /r , 1 < p < ∞, r ∈ N, 0 ≤ β < 1 -1

p.s: p and a function ω of the modulus of continuity type satisfies the conditions:

div.formula: π r(n+1) 0 t|ψ x (t)|| sin rt 2 | β ω(t) p dt 1/p = O x (n + 1) -1 , (11
when r = 1 or π r(n+1) 0 |ψ x (t)|| sin rt 2 | β ω(t) p dt 1/p = O x (1), (12

p.s: when r ≥ 2, and

div.formula: π r π r(n+1) |ψ x (t)|| sin rt 2 | β ω(t)t γ p dt 1/p = O x (n + 1) γ , (13

p.s: for r ∈ N with 0 < γ < β + 1 p .
If a matrix A is such that (8) and (9) are true, then

div.formula: T n,A f (x) -f r x, π r(n + 1) = O x (n + 1) β+ 1 p +1 A n,r ω π n + 1 . Theorem 2 Suppose that f ∈ L p 2π /r , 1 < p < ∞, r ∈ N, 0 ≤ β < 1 -1

p.s: p and a function ω of the modulus of continuity type satisfies the conditions (12) and (13) for r ∈ N with 0 < γ < β + 1 p .
If a matrix A is such that (10) and (9) are true, then

div.formula: T n,A f (x) -f r x, π r(n + 1) = O x (n + 1) β+ 1 p +1 A n,r ω π n + 1 .

p.s: Remark 1 The Hölder inequality gives
and thus the condition (8) implies (10), but the condition (12) implies (11).
Therefore Theorems 1 and 2 are not comparable.

div.formula: Theorem 3 Let f ∈ L p 2π /r ( ω) β , 1 < p < ∞, r ∈ N and 0 ≤ β < 1 -1 p .

p.s: If a matrix A is such that (9) and (8) or (10) are true, then

div.formula: T n,A f (•) -f r •, π r(n + 1) L p 2π /r = O x (n + 1) β+ 1 p +1 A n,r ω π n + 1 .

p.s: Corollary 1 Taking r = 1 the conditions (11) and (13) in Theorem 1 reduce to (1) and (2).
Thus we obtain the results from [2] and Theorem A [1, Theorem 8, p. 95], but in the case of [3] (Theorem B and C) we reduce the assumptions.
Next, using more natural conditions when β > 0 we can formulate, without proofs, the following theorems.

div.formula: Theorem 4 Suppose that f ∈ L p 2π /r , 1 < p < ∞, r ∈ N, 0 < β < 1 -1 p .

p.s: Let a function ω of the modulus of continuity type satisfy the conditions:

div.formula: π r π r(n+1) t -γ |ψ x (t)|| sin rt 2 | β ω(t) p dt 1/p = O x (n + 1) γ -1 p (14)

p.s: for γ ∈ ( 1 p , 1 p + β) and r ∈ N (instead of (13)), and

div.formula: π r(n+1) 0 t|ψ x (t)|| sin rt 2 | β ω(t) p dt 1/p = O x (n + 1) -1-1 p when r = 1 or π r(n+1) 0 |ψ x (t)|| sin rt 2 | β ω(t) p dt 1/p = O x (n + 1) -1 p (15)

p.s: when r ≥ 2 (instead of (11) and (12), respectively).
If a matrix A is such that (9) and (8) are true, then

div.formula: T n,A f (x) -f r x, π r(n + 1) = O x (n + 1) β+1 A n,r ω π n + 1 . (16

p.s: Moreover, if a function ω of the modulus of continuity type and a matrix A satisfy the following conditions: (14) with r ∈ N and γ ∈ ( 1 p , 1 p + β), (15) with r ∈ N, (9) and (10), then the estimate (16) is also true.

div.formula: Theorem 5 Let f ∈ L p 2π /r ( ω) β with 1 < p < ∞, r ∈ N and 0 < β < 1 -1

p.s: p .
If a matrix A is such that (9) and (8) or (10) are true, then

div.formula: T n,A f (•) -f r •, π r(n + 1) L p 2π /r = O x (n + 1) β+1 A n,r ω π n + 1 .

p.s: Remark 2 We note that our extra conditions (9), ( 8) and (10) for a lower triangular infinite matrix A • always hold.

div.head: Corollary 2 Considering the above remarks and the obvious inequality

p.s: A n,r ≤ rA n,1 for r ∈ N (17)
our results also improve and generalize the mentioned result of Krasniqi [1].
Remark 3 We note that instead of L p 2π /r ( ω) β one can consider another subclass of L p 2π /r generated by any function of the modulus of continuity type e.g.
ω x such that

div.formula: ω x (f , δ) = sup |t|≤δ ψ x (t) ≤ ω x (δ)

p.s: or

div.formula: ω x (f , δ) = 1 δ δ 0 ψ x (t) dt ≤ ω x (δ).

div.head: Auxiliary results

p.s: We begin this section by some notations from [5] and [4, Sect. 5 of Chapter II].
Let for r = 1, 2, . . .
It is clear by [4] that

div.formula: D • k,r (t) = sin (2k+r)t 2 2 sin rt 2 , D • k,r (t) = cos (2k+r)t
S k f (x) = - 1 π π -π f (x + t) D k,1 (t) dt and T n,A f (x) = - 1 π π -π f (x + t) ∞ k=0 a n,k D k,1 (t) dt.

p.s: Now, we present a very useful property of the modulus of continuity.

div.head: Lemma 1 ([4]

p.s: ) A function ω of modulus of continuity type on the interval [0, 2π] satisfies the following condition:
Next, we present the following well-known estimates.

div.formula: Lemma 2 ([4]) If 0 < |t| ≤ π then D • k,1 (t) ≤ π 2|t| , D k,1 (t) ≤ π |t|

p.s: and, for any real t, we have

div.formula: D • k,1 (t) ≤ k + 1 2 , D k,1 (t) ≤ 1 2 k(k + 1)|t|, D k,1 (t) ≤ k + 1. Lemma 3 ([5, 6]) Let r ∈ N , l ∈ Z and (a n ) ⊂ C. If t = 2lπ r , then for every m ≥ n m k=n a k sin kt = - m k=n (a k -a k+r ) D • k,r (t) + m+r k=m+1 a k D • k,-r (t) - n+r-1 k=n a k D • k,-r (t), m k=n a k cos kt = m k=n (a k -a k+r )D • k,r (t) - m+r k=m+1 a k D • k,-r (t) + n+r-1 k=n a k D • k,-r (t).

p.s: We additionally need the following estimate as a consequence of Lemma 3.

div.formula: Lemma 4 Let r ∈ N, l ∈ Z and (a n,k ) ⊂ R + 0 for n.k ∈ N 0 . If t = 2lπ r , then 1 2 ∞ k=0 a n,k cos (2k + 1)t 2 ≤ 1 2| sin rt 2 | A n,r + r-1 k=0 a n,k ≤ 1 | sin rt 2 | A n,r . Proof By Lemma 3, 1 2 ∞ k=0 a n,k cos (2k + 1)t 2 = 1 2 ∞ k=0 a n,k cos kt cos t 2 - ∞ k=0 a n,k sin kt sin t 2 = cos t 2 2 ∞ k=0 (a n,k -a n,k+r )D • k,r (t) + r-1 k=0 a n,k D • k,-r (t) - sin t 2 2 - ∞ k=0 (a n,k -a n,k+r ) D • k,r (t) - r-1 k=0 a n,k D • k,-r (t)

p.s: and our inequalities follow.
We also need some special conditions which follow from the ones mentioned above.
Lemma 5 Suppose that f ∈ L p 2π /r , where 1 ≤ p < ∞ and r ∈ N. If the condition (12) holds with any function ω of the modulus of continuity type and β ≥ 0, then

div.formula: 2(m+1)π r 2(m+1)π r -π r(n+1) |ψ x (t)| ω( 2(m+1)π r -t) p sin rt 2 βp dt 1 p = O x (1)

p.s: Proof By the substitution t = 2(m+1)π r u, we obtain

div.formula: 2(m+1)π r 2(m+1)π r -π r(n+1) |ψ x (t)| ω( 2(m+1)π r -t) p sin rt 2 βp dt 1/p = π r(n+1) 0 |ψ x ( 2(m+1)π r -u)| ω(u) sin r 2 2(m + 1)π r -u β p du 1/p = π r(n+1) 0 |ψ x (u)| ω(u) sin ru 2 β p du 1/p .

p.s: Hence, by (12) our estimate follows.
Lemma 6 Suppose that f ∈ L p 2π /r , where 1 ≤ p < ∞ and r ∈ N. If the condition (12) holds with any function ω of the modulus of continuity type and β ≥ 0, then

div.formula: 2mπ r + π r(n+1) 2mπ r |ψ x (t)| ω(t -2mπ r ) p sin rt 2 βp dt 1 p = O x (1)

p.s: Proof By the substitution t = 2mπ r + u, analogously to the above proof, we obtain 2mπ

div.formula: r + π r(n+1) 2mπ r |ψ x (t)| ω(t -2mπ r ) p sin rt 2 βp dt 1/p = π r(n+1) 0 |ψ x ( 2mπ r + u)| ω(u) sin r 2 2mπ r + u β p du 1/p ≤ π r(n+1) 0 |ψ x (u)| ω(u) sin ru 2 β p dt 1/p = O x (1)

p.s: and we have the desired estimate.
Now, we formulate another two lemmas without proofs.
We can prove them in the same way as Lemmas 5 and 6, respectively.
Lemma 7 Suppose that f ∈ L p 2π /r , where 1 ≤ p < ∞ and r ∈ N. If the condition (13) holds with any function ω of the modulus of continuity type and γ , β ≥ 0, then

div.formula: 2(m+1)π r -π r(n+1) 2(m+1)π r -π r |ψ x (t)|| sin rt 2 | β ω(t)( 2(m+1)π r -t) γ p dt 1/p = O x (n + 1) γ , where m ∈ {0, . . . [ r 2 ] -1}.

p.s: Lemma 8 Suppose that f ∈ L p 2π /r , where 1 ≤ p < ∞ and r ∈ N. If the condition (13) holds with any function ω of the modulus of continuity type and γ , β ≥ 0, then

div.formula: 2mπ r + π r 2mπ r + π r(n+1) |ψ x (t)|| sin rt 2 | β ω(t)(t -2mπ r ) γ p dt 1/p = O x (n + 1) γ ,

p.s: where m ∈ {0, . . .

div.head: Proofs of theorems 4.1 Proof of Theorem 1

p.s: It is clear that for odd r

div.formula: T n,A f (x) -f r x, π r(n + 1) = - 1 π π 0 ψ x (t) ∞ k=0 a n,k D k,1 (t) dt + 1 π [r/2]-1 m=0 2(m+1)π r -π r(n+1) 2mπ r + π r(n+1) + (2[r/2]+1)π r 2[r/2]π r + π r(n+1) ψ x (t) 1 2 cot t 2 dt = - 1 π π r(n+1) 0 + [r/2] m=1 2mπ r + π r(n+1) 2mπ r + [r/2]-1 m=0 2(m+1)π r 2(m+1)π r -π r(n+1) × ψ x (t) ∞ k=0 a n,k D k,1 (t) dt + 1 π [r/2] m=0 2(m+1)π r 2mπ r + π r(n+1) + [r/2]-1 m=0 2(m+1)π r -π r(n+1) (2m+1)π r ψ x (t) ∞ k=0 a n,k D • k,1 (t) dt = I 0 (x) + I 1 (x) + I 2 (x) + I 3 (x) + I 4 (x)

p.s: and for even r

div.formula: T n,A f (x) -f r x, π r(n + 1) = - 1 π π 0 ψ x (t) ∞ k=0 a n,k D k,1 (t) dt + 1 π [r/2]-1 m=0 2(m+1)π r -π r(n+1) 2mπ r + π r(n+1) ψ x (t) 1 2 cot t 2 dt = - 1 π π r(n+1) 0 + [r/2]-1 m=1 2mπ r + π r(n+1) 2mπ r + [r/2]-1 m=0 2(m+1)π r 2(m+1)π r -π r(n+1) × ψ x (t) ∞ k=0 a n,k D k,1 (t) dt + 1 π [r/2]-1 m=0 (2m+1)π r 2mπ r + π r(n+1) + [r/2]-1 m=0 2(m+1)π r -π r(n+1) (2m+1)π r × ψ x (t) ∞ k=0 a n,k D • k,1 (t) dt = I 0 (x) + I 1 (x) + I 2 (x) + I 3 (x) + I 4 (x), whence T n,A f (x) -f r x, π r(n + 1)

p.s: Next, using Lemma 2, (8), the Hölder inequality with p > 1 and q = p p-1 and (11) when r = 1 or (12) when r ≥ 2 we get

div.formula: I 0 (x) = O (n + 1) 2 π r(n+1) 0 t ψ x (t) dt ≤ O (n + 1) 2 π r(n+1) 0 t|ψ x (t)| ω(t) p sin βp rt 2 dt 1/p π r(n+1) 0 ω(t) sin β rt 2 q dt 1 q ≤ O (n + 1) 2 O x (n + 1) -1 ω π r(n + 1) π r(n+1) 0 π rt βq dt 1 q = O x (n + 1) ω π r(n + 1) π r(n + 1) 1 q -β = O x (n + 1) β+ 1 p ω π n + 1 , for 0 ≤ β < 1 -1 p .

p.s: We note that applying the condition (9) we have

div.formula: (n + 1)A n,r -1 = n l=0 A n,r -1 ≤ n l=0 ∞ k=l |a n,k -a n,k+r | -1 ≤ n l=0 ∞ k=l (a n,k -a n,k+r ) -1 = n l=0 r+l-1 k=l a n,k -1 = O(1), whence I 0 (x) = O x (n + 1) 1+β+ 1 p A n,r ω π n + 1 .

p.s: By Lemma 2
π/r dt and using the Hölder inequality with p > 1 and q = p p-1

div.formula: I 1 (x) + I 1 (x) + I 2 (x) ≤ O x (1) [r/2] m=1 2mπ r + π r(n+1) 2mπ r |ψ x (t)| sin β rt 2 ω(t -2mπ r ) p dt 1 p × 2mπ r + π r(n+1) 2mπ r ω(t -2mπ r ) sin β rt 2 q dt 1 q + O x (1) [r/2]-1 m=1 2(m+1)π r 2(m+1)π r -π r(n+1) |ψ x (t)| sin β rt 2 ω( 2(m+1)π r -t) p dt 1 p × 2(m+1)π r 2(m+1)π r -π r(n+1) ω( 2(m+1)π r -t) sin β rt 2 q dt 1 q

p.s: . Hence, by Lemmas 5 and 6 with (12) and (9),

div.formula: I 1 (x) + I 1 (x) + I 2 (x) = O x (1) ω π r(n + 1) π r(n+1) 0 1 sin β rt 2 q dt 1 q = O x (n + 1) β-1 q ω π n + 1 = O x (n + 1) β+ 1 p A n,r ω π n + 1 ,

Collecting the partial estimates our statement follows.
The proof is the same as above, but for estimate of |I 0 (x)| we only used the inequality | D k,1 (t)| ≤ k + 1 from Lemma 2, and the condition (10) instead of (8).
We note that for the estimate of
we need the conditions on ω from the assumptions of Theorems 1 or 2. These conditions always hold with ψ • (t) L p 2π /r instead of |ψ x (t)| and thus the desired result follows.

analytic.title: Slight extensions of some theorems on the rate of pointwise approximation of functions from some subclasses of L p
Approximation of functions belonging to the class L p (ω) by linear operators
Pointwise approximation of modified conjugate functions by matrix operators of their Fourier series
A new class of numerical sequences and its applications to uniform convergence of sine series
